activities: Garmin International, Inc. engages in the design, manufacture, and marketing of navigation, communications, and information products, which are enabled by global positioning system (GPS) technology worldwide.  Certain products may be purchased at www.garmin.com, which purchases result in the receipt of personal information from the EU.  Personal information may also be received from the EU as a result of voluntary disclosure of such information to Garmin. Garmin International, Inc. may also receive personal information of employees in connection with Garmin’s Compliance Hotline.
contacttitle1: Vice President, General Counsel and Secretary
corpofftitle1: Vice President, General Counsel and Secretary
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Croatia, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom
personaldata: Online; customer; employee with respect to Compliance Hotine
privacyprograms: Garmin International, Inc. is a licensee of the TRUSTe Privacy Program.
recoursemech: TRUSTe Privacy Program for customer complaints; EU data protection authorities and the Swiss Federal Data Protection and Information Commissioner for employee complaints
